parameters.definition: Units of water required by the small container
Units of powdered pill required by the small container
Units of paste produced by the small container
Units of water required by the large container
Units of powdered pill required by the large container
Units of paste produced by the large container
Total units of powdered pill available

description: There are two specialized containers, a small and large one, that are used to make a pharmaceutical paste. The small container requires \param{WaterSmall} units of water and \param{PillSmall} units of the powdered pill to make \param{PasteSmall} units of the paste. The large container requires \param{WaterLarge} units of water and \param{PillLarge} units of the powdered pill to make \param{PasteLarge} units of the paste. The pharmacy has available \param{TotalWater} units of water and \param{TotalPill} units of the powdered pill. How many of each container should be used to maximize the amount of paste that can be made?
